### arXiv provides RSS service officially

### The alphaXiv in the menu bar can help users understand the hottest papers in the entire AI field recently, these papers are must-reads

### Each researcher or engineer has their own specialized subfield, such as agent memory, reinforcement learning, etc. Subscribing to arXiv RSS can push you the latest papers in your subfield every day, just like actively searching on arXiv every day

### It is recommended to use the open-source <mark>[arXiv RSS URL Generator](https://ronpay.github.io/arxiv-rss-feed-generator/)</mark>

### Set an appropriate search query for your RSS. For example, if I focus on agent memory research papers, I can set it like this:
![](images/arxiv1.png)

### It is recommended to explore more and try different search queries to get the best search results

### After setting, click Generate RSS URL, and the website will generate an RSS Feed URL
![](images/arxiv2.png)


### Finally, paste the RSS Feed URL into the RSS URL input box at the top of the page, click the Add button to subscribe
![](images/RSS_URL.png)

### arXiv RSS updates approximately once a day
